intro: Melilotus rotundifolius, commonly known as roundleaf melilot, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow pea-like flowers. The plant has round or ovate leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas. Melilotus rotundifolius is also valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
